title: Franck Tournaire
text:
Franck Tournaire (born 4 December 1972 in <a href="Narbonne">Narbonne</a>) is a former <a href="France">French</a> international professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player now playing amateur rugby for <a href="US%20Carcassonne">US Carcassonne</a>.
As a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%231.%20Loosehead%20prop%20.26%203.%20Tighthead%20prop">prop</a>, Tournaire played for <a href="RC%20Narbonne">Narbonne</a>, <a href="Stade%20Toulousain">Toulouse</a>, <a href="Leicester%20Tigers">Leicester</a>, <a href="USA%20Perpignan">Perpignan</a> and <a href="RC%20Narbonne">Narbonne</a> again, ending in <a href="Pro%20D2">Pro D2</a> his professional career at the <a href="Racing%20M%C3%A9tro%2092%20Paris">Racing Métro 92 Paris</a>.
After retiring in 2008, Tournaire joined amateur club US Carcassonne in southern France.
Tournaire won 49 full caps for the <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">French national team</a> and won 2 <a href="RBS%206%20Nations">Five Nations</a> (<a href="1997%20Five%20Nations%20Championship">1997</a> and <a href="1998%20Five%20Nations%20Championship">1998</a> both Grand Slams) and played in the <a href="1999%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">1999 Rugby World Cup</a> where France were the runners-up losing in the final to <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a>.
